package_identity.package_description: Local taxation system for residential properties to fund local services including police, fire, waste collection, schools and other essential council services

service_overview.what_is_council_tax: Council Tax is a property-based tax charged on domestic properties. It helps fund essential local services provided by Gloucester City Council, Gloucestershire County Council, and the Police and Crime Commissioner. The amount you pay depends on your property's valuation band and who lives there.
what_it_pays_for: Local services from Gloucester City Council (waste collection, street cleaning, parks, leisure facilities)
County Council services (adult social care, children's services, schools, highways, libraries)
Police and Crime Commissioner for Gloucestershire
Parish/Town Council precepts (where applicable - e.g. Quedgeley)

primary_legislation.what_law_requires: Billing authorities must levy and collect Council Tax on domestic properties in their area

key_sections.purpose: Defines Council Tax, liability hierarchy, and valuation bands

property_premiums.overview: Premiums add extra charges to the Council Tax bill to incentivise bringing empty properties into use and discouraging second homes. These changes took effect from 1 April 2025 following the Levelling-up and Regeneration Act 2023.

legal_basis.legislation: Local Government Finance Act 1992, Sections 11B and 11C (as amended by Levelling-up and Regeneration Act 2023)

empty_homes_premium.what_it_is: Additional charge on top of standard Council Tax to encourage owners to bring empty properties back into use

1_to_2_years.empty_period: Empty and unfurnished for 1 year or more (from 1 April 2025)
1_to_2_years.note: Previously applied after 2 years - reduced to 1 year from April 2025

2_to_5_years.empty_period: Empty and unfurnished for 2 years or more

5_to_10_years.empty_period: Empty and unfurnished for 5 years or more

10_plus_years.empty_period: Empty and unfurnished for 10 years or more (from 1 April 2021)

property_based_charge.applies_to_property: Premium applies to property, not owner
property_based_charge.change_of_ownership: Buying property already empty means you inherit the premium
property_based_charge.removal: Premium only removed by bringing property back into use or qualifying for exception

qualifying_exceptions: Property where occupation is prohibited by planning restrictions
Property held by trustee in bankruptcy
Property of deceased person (for up to 6 months after grant of probate)
Property where owner moved to care home
Property where owner is providing care elsewhere
exceptions.evidence_required: Must provide evidence to demonstrate exception applies

legal_basis.legislation: Local Government Finance Act 1992, Sections 11B and 11C (as amended by Levelling-up and Regeneration Act 2023)

second_homes_premium.what_it_is: Additional 100% charge on furnished properties not occupied as anyone's sole or main residence

premium_rate.applies_to: Properties which are furnished but not occupied as sole or main residence

definition.second_home: Furnished property where there is no resident (sole or main residence)
definition.note: Formerly no discount was awarded - from April 2025 there is a 100% premium

exceptions.job_related: 50% discount may apply if second home is job-related (see job-related second home discount)
exceptions.other_exceptions: See legislation for full list of statutory exceptions
exceptions.application: From 1 April 2025 can apply for exception with evidence

holiday_lets_and_self_catering.overview: Holiday lets and self-catering accommodation occupy a unique position - they can be liable for either Council Tax OR Business Rates depending on usage. This is a critical boundary that affects whether second homes premium applies.

legal_basis.legislation: Non-Domestic Rating (Definition of Domestic Property) Order 1991 (as amended)
legal_basis.voa_authority: Valuation Office Agency determines whether property is domestic (Council Tax) or non-domestic (Business Rates)
legal_basis.changes_april_2023: New stricter eligibility rules from 1 April 2023 make it harder to qualify for Business Rates

criteria_all_must_be_met.rule: Available to let commercially for short periods totalling at least 140 days in previous 12 months AND in current 12 months
criteria_all_must_be_met.evidence: Marketing evidence, calendar availability, advertising on commercial platforms

criteria_all_must_be_met.rule: Actually let commercially for at least 70 days in previous 12 months
criteria_all_must_be_met.evidence: Booking records, receipts for rental income, occupancy data
criteria_all_must_be_met.counting_rule: Property occupied immediately before midnight counts as one day let

criteria_all_must_be_met.rule: Let on commercial basis with view to making profit
criteria_all_must_be_met.evidence: Market rate pricing, active marketing, business records
criteria_all_must_be_met.not_commercial: Letting only to friends/family at nominal rates, or purely for personal use

criteria_all_must_be_met.rule: Owner intends to make available for at least 140 days in following 12 months

exclusions_from_day_counts: Nights property closed for repair or refurbishment
Personal use by owner (counts toward availability but not actual lettings)

new_properties.transition: Remains on Council Tax until meets 140 days available AND 70 days let
new_properties.switch_date: Day 141 (if criteria met) - moves to Business Rates
new_properties.example: New holiday let advertised Day 1, if let for 70 of first 140 days and will continue being available, switches to Business Rates on Day 141

existing_properties.voa_compliance_checks: VOA conducts rolling programme of checks via 'Request for Information' forms
existing_properties.must_respond: Financial penalty if fail to respond to VOA form
existing_properties.moved_to_council_tax: If fail to meet criteria, VOA removes from Business Rates list and adds to Council Tax list
existing_properties.backdated_bills: May face backdated Council Tax bills if should have been on Council Tax list

when_liable: Property does not meet 140/70 day Business Rates criteria
Property removed from Business Rates list by VOA for non-compliance
New property not yet qualified for Business Rates (first 140 days minimum)
Owner chooses not to pursue Business Rates assessment

if_furnished_not_main_residence.rate: 200% of standard Council Tax (100% premium) from 1 April 2025
if_furnished_not_main_residence.note: This is why failing Business Rates criteria is very expensive - you pay double Council Tax instead of Business Rates

if_unfurnished.charge: Standard Council Tax or empty homes premium depending on duration

liability_person.owner_liable: Owner liable for Council Tax on holiday let, not guests/tenants
liability_person.joint_owners: Joint and several liability if multiple owners

if_eligible.charge: Business Rates instead of Council Tax
if_eligible.assessment: Valuation Office Agency sets rateable value
if_eligible.billing: Gloucester City Council bills and collects Business Rates
if_eligible.note: Business Rates often lower than Council Tax for small properties

small_business_rate_relief.eligibility: If only letting one property AND rateable value under £15,000
small_business_rate_relief.relief: Up to 100% relief depending on rateable value
small_business_rate_relief.apply: Download form from council website or contact revenues@gloucester.gov.uk
small_business_rate_relief.note: This makes Business Rates very attractive if you can qualify - potentially zero rates

second_homes_vs_holiday_lets.second_home: Furnished property not let commercially - pays 200% Council Tax from April 2025
second_homes_vs_holiday_lets.holiday_let_qualifying: Meets 140/70 criteria - pays Business Rates (potentially with relief)
second_homes_vs_holiday_lets.holiday_let_not_qualifying: Does not meet 140/70 criteria - pays 200% Council Tax as second home
second_homes_vs_holiday_lets.financial_difference: Massive financial incentive to meet Business Rates criteria or make property main residence

policy_intent.government: Tighter rules from April 2023 to stop 'fake' holiday lets avoiding Council Tax
policy_intent.council: Second homes premium from April 2025 to discourage empty properties and encourage residential use
policy_intent.combined_effect: Properties must be genuinely commercially let OR occupied as main residence - middle ground very expensive

new_holiday_let: Property initially on Council Tax list
Market commercially for at least 140 days
Achieve at least 70 days actual commercial lettings
After Day 141, contact VOA to request Business Rates assessment
VOA will request evidence and assess
If approved, moved from Council Tax to Business Rates (typically 12 weeks)
existing_holiday_let: VOA will send 'Request for Information' form
Must respond with evidence of 140 days availability and 70 days lettings
If fail to meet criteria, moved back to Council Tax (with second homes premium)
stop_being_holiday_let: Tell VOA immediately if stop commercial letting
Property moved from Business Rates to Council Tax
If don't inform, may face backdated Council Tax bill

evidence_to_maintain: Marketing materials and listings (Airbnb, Booking.com, etc)
contact_and_evidence.annual_declaration: VOA may require annual declaration that criteria still met

scenario_1.situation: Own second home, let to friends/family occasionally at low rates
scenario_1.outcome: Not commercial letting - liable for Council Tax with 200% second homes premium

scenario_2.situation: Airbnb property, available 200 days, actually let 90 days commercially
scenario_2.outcome: Meets criteria - eligible for Business Rates (potentially with small business relief)

scenario_3.situation: Holiday let, available 140 days but only actually let 50 days
scenario_3.outcome: Fails 70-day letting test - liable for Council Tax with 200% second homes premium

scenario_4.situation: New holiday let, first 100 days, let for 60 days so far
scenario_4.outcome: Still on Council Tax (no premium yet as working toward qualification), will switch to Business Rates at Day 141 if hits 70 days

scenario_5.situation: Former holiday let stopped commercial letting
scenario_5.outcome: Must tell VOA - moves to Council Tax, if keep furnished and not main residence pays 200% as second home
